home.subtitle: Model-Based Robustness, Reliability & Resilience
home.description: Research & Development in model discovery, simulation-based “what‑if” analysis, and formal causal inference.

whatWeDo.title: What we do
whatWeDo.intro: MB3R Lab is an R&D group working on automatic model discovery and simulation-driven resilience analysis for distributed systems (e.g., microservices).

modelDiscovery.title: Model Discovery
modelDiscovery.text: synthesize system dependency models from configuration, traces, and telemetry.

whatIf.title: What‑if Simulation
whatIf.text: run Monte-Carlo failure scenarios on the discovered model without touching production.

causalResilience.title: Causal Resilience
causalResilience.text: sheaf-theoretic analysis and Effective Information (EI) to identify macro-structures that improve predictability and control.

bering.title: Bering — Model Discovery
bering.text: Automatically derive a live dependency model of your information system from configs and traces; run what‑if failure simulations offline.

sheaft.title: Sheaft — Simulation-based chaos engineering & causal analysis
sheaft.text: Run simulation-first chaos experiments and quantify causal emergence with sheaf-theoretic EI to find resilient macro-structures.

asyncSemantics.title: Evaluating Asynchronous Semantics in Trace-Discovered Resilience Models: A Case Study on the OpenTelemetry Demo
asyncSemantics.text: Extends the experimental validation of the model discovery concept to a new system (the OpenTelemetry Demo) and a new grain of complexity (asynchronous semantics), comparing the trace-derived model against live chaos experiments.

uncertainty.title: Measuring Uncertainty in Transformer Circuits with Effective Information Consistency
uncertainty.text: This paper introduces the Effective-Information Consistency Score to quantify uncertainty in Transformer Circuits. This white-box, single-pass metric helps attribute uncertainty to specific mechanisms within LLMs.

modelDiscovery.title: Model Discovery and Graph Simulation: A Lightweight Gateway to Chaos Engineering
modelDiscovery.text: Offline resilience estimation from a dependency graph; compares simulations to live failure injection on a microservice benchmark.

sheaf.title: Sheaf-Theoretic Causal Emergence for Resilience Analysis in Distributed Systems
sheaf.text: Unifies sheaves, flow simulation, and EI for multi-level causal analysis.

aina.title: Refining Resilience Model Discovery: A Case Study on the Limited Role of Asynchronous Edges in the OpenTelemetry Demo
aina.text: The incremental paper was accepted to the CORE B conference AINA 2026.

asyncResilience.title: Async resilience preprint
asyncResilience.text: Extended our experimental validation of the model discovery concept to the OpenTelemetry Demo, incorporating asynchronous semantics as an additional complexity grain.

icse.title: ICSE 2026 NIER acceptance
icse.text: Our paper “Model Discovery and Graph Simulation: A Lightweight Gateway to Chaos Engineering” was accepted to the ICSE 2026 NIER track, which recognizes our commitment to safer, simulation-driven resilience.

causalAi.title: Causal AI publication
causalAi.text: Documented Effective-Information metrics for transformer circuits and published the results.

landing.title: Public landing launched
landing.text: Released mb3r-lab.github.io with a pilot intake flow and project overview.

benchmark.title: Bering benchmark
benchmark.text: Reproduced Bering simulations on a microservice benchmark to validate offline chaos runs.

sheaft.title: Sheaft framework
sheaft.text: Introduced the theoretical foundation for sheaf-based causal analysis in distributed systems.
